content.p: An air ambulance service provider that meets the requirements of AS 21.61.105 may offer an air ambulance membership agreement.
The term of an air ambulance membership agreement may not exceed one year, but may be renewed annually.

An air ambulance membership agreement may not include a provision that requires an air ambulance service provider to pay for or indemnify a person for services provided by a third party, including a third party that is another air ambulance service provider.

section.heading: Registration of air ambulance service providers.

content.p: An air ambulance service provider that offers an air ambulance membership agreement shall register biennially with the director on a form prescribed by the director.
At the time of registration, an air ambulance service provider shall supply the director with evidence that the air ambulance service provider
has been certified as meeting the minimum standards prescribed by the Department of Health under AS 18.08.082
has been in operation in the state for at least two years, or meets solvency requirements established by the director in regulation.

In addition to the provisions of this chapter, the following provisions of this title apply to air ambulance service providers and air ambulance membership agreements to the extent applicable and not in conflict with the express provisions of this chapter and the reasonable implications of the express provisions:

When applying the provisions listed in (a) of this section, the director shall treat an air ambulance service provider as an insurer and an air ambulance membership agreement as an excepted benefits insurance policy under AS 21.54.160 .
Except as provided in this section, an air ambulance service provider or an air ambulance membership agreement that complies with this chapter is not otherwise subject to this title.
Sec. 21.61.109. Regulations. The director may adopt regulations to implement this chapter.
